item.title: Dumped clothing and bedding, 4th August
item.description:
We have seen a growing trend in fly tipping on our street. There are two instances of dumped clothing on our street. One is outside number 2 and the other is the top end of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hopedale Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Pavement Parking, 4th August
item.description:
Parking in front garden, mounting pavement in order to park. Obstructing on-street parking bay. People are reluctant to park in the bay because their vehicle may get damaged my owner at 24C.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree Damage and On Pavement Parking, 4th August
item.description:
24C parking work vehicle in front garden from 1am in the morning. The fence has been removed to facilitate the electric van mounting the pavement to access the front garden space. Causing damage to the young tree planted next the first speed bump.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enfield council waste services not cleaning streets, 4th August
item.description:
It is six weeks in now into no street clean or ‘cleanse’ for eversely park road and prince georges avenue. Chaseville park road too is having to be cleaned by volunteers. And church hill has not been cleaned in any part of July. The published rota states that each of these roads are cleaned once a week. This is not true. Our bins overflow by Friday and are not emptied again until the week after, when reminded - and there is only one bin - in picture - at each end of hoppers road - one of the busiest roads in Winchmore Hill due to LTNs. The image of the cardboard box is one I take every week and date to show prince George’s Avenue has not been cleaned in six weeks. The box was still there today, Sunday 3rd August. The published street cleaning rota is not what is actually happening - or not.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eversley Park Road, Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
